pros: Non-Profit company. Focus on employees. Lots of opportunities for advancement. Good people to work with.

job_title: Human Resources Officer in Prince Albert, SK
pros: Awesome place to work and had alot of work structure
cons: Management tends to keep a keen eye on everyone,,cameras and bioscans..disciplinary processes were strict..

pros: Steady work hours, guaranteed shifts. You get free food from time to time which is nice. Also great benefits after your probation is over. Friendly staff.
cons: Disorganized management. Every supervisor and manager from every other department seems to be your boss. Your actual department manager gets overwritten by other department managers all the time, so you spend a lot of time doing extra stuff on top of your regular job. In the end you have to work faster in order to keep up with all the extra stuff that gets handed to you.

job_title: Senior Accounting Officer in Saskatoon, SK
pros: Great working environment and good benefits. Staff is easy going
cons: High volume of work during month end closing

review_title: Great place to work with great people
pros: Great benefits with a positive work environment
cons: Very late shifts, will need your own transportation to get to and from office. Public transportation ends long before your shift ends.

review_title: Great organization, great people, great culture
pros: Great community focused culture with a game changing organization that heavily invests in its employees and in its community.
cons: The organization was completely dependent on revenue from physical land based casinos and was heavily impacted during the pandemic. They are working on developing new income streams including online gaming to diversify.
